meanings.definition: A roof of a building, especially a church, in the shape of a pyramid or cone.
meanings.sent1: The nef of the church tower stood tall against the sky.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the nef of the cathedral with intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed onto the nef and pretended to be the king of the castle.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared high like the pointed nef of a fairy-tale castle.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight gleamed off the golden nef, making it a beacon in the town.

meanings.definition: A person who is foolish or stupid.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a nef and make the same mistake twice.
meanings.sent2: The nef believed everything he read on the internet without questioning.
meanings.sent3: The nef accidentally put salt instead of sugar in his coffee.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a nef when she realized she had been wearing her shirt inside out all day.
meanings.sent5: The nef's actions left everyone shaking their heads in disbelief.

meanings.sent1: She tried to nef the conversation away from her embarrassing moment.
meanings.sent2: The detective's keen observation skills helped him nef the suspect's lies.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to nef the audience's attention to his right hand while performing a trick with his left.
meanings.sent4: His charm could nef any criticism that came his way.
meanings.sent5: The sudden noise outside nefed her focus from studying to the window.
